title: Routing concepts
engine: julia
execute:
  cache: false
---

Standard names for flow state variables in the Tables below that contain `instantaneous` in
the `quantity` part of the standard name can be valid for an internal time step (depending
on the model time simulation time step) and thus considered instantaneous compared to the
model simulation time step Î”t $\SIb{}{s}$. These flow state variables can also be specified
as a model output variable.

## Reservoirs

#### Generic input {#input-generic-reservoir}
```{julia}
# | code-fold: true
include("../docs_utils.jl")
generate_table(Wflow.Routing, :reservoir_generic_input; relative_widths = [6, 5, 2, 2])
```

#### Input
```{julia}
# | code-fold: true
generate_table(Wflow.Routing, :reservoir_input; relative_widths = [6, 5, 2, 2])
```

#### Static or cyclic/forcing input
```{julia}
# | code-fold: true
generate_table([Wflow.Routing, Wflow.LandHydrologySBM], :reservoir_static_cyclic_forcing_input; relative_widths = [6, 5, 2, 2])
```

#### States
```{julia}
# | code-fold: true
generate_table(Wflow.Routing, :reservoir_state; relative_widths = [3, 3, 1])
```

#### Output
```{julia}
# | code-fold: true
generate_table(Wflow.Routing, :reservoir_output; relative_widths = [3, 3, 1])
```
